intro: Vernonia coriacea, commonly known as rough vervain, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flower heads. The plant has hairy, gray-green leaves and is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Vernonia coriacea is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects. It also serves as a valuable nectar source for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
